ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 9: This was a great trip and well planned. We saw a lot of different types of forestry in Louisiana. Although I am not a true forester, I enjoyed the experience and leaned a lot from my fellow classmates and the instructors.
This field trip is a necessary part of the MF curriculum. Unquestionably.
The "day off" in the middle. We did a nice nature hike, but I thought it was important to have individual time as well to relax from constant traveling.

I started with almost no knowledge on forestry, and learned a TON. It was a delightful week for me, and incredibly cool to learn so much from the professors, students, guest lecturers and general osmosis. Best of all, I was responsible for actually learning none of the info, so I was able to take it all in as I wished.The other great thing was that intentionally or not, the crew was fantastic. We were an efficient, cohesive and riotously funny group.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Trying to fit too many things into each day. It worked out well and I think the instructors have learned from past trips what is too much.

We kept such a rigorous pace of guest lectures, etc, that we never made time to debrief the information we'd learned each day. That would be invaluable to actually making some meaning from the full week's experiences.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both instructors were very available for feedback.
Exceptional. Mike especially deserves credit for thoughtful answers to questions, and indeed accurately prompting our guest lecturers to address our questions before we were even able to ask them.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: It does not really fit into my overall program, but I enjoyed learning forestry when I had little prior knowledge.
It doesn't at all, and that's why I loved it. I'm a bit of a forester-wannabe, so this was a great time to really learn.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I study wildland fire management, so I enjoyed going on the prescribed burn.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
Did you get out of it what you expected?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Oh, the usual. Learn more from other folks, but takes a great deal longer.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't plan on getting any other work done this week. It is a great experience and it does a good job of combining academic work with fun.
Ask a majillion questions of all the guest lecturers. They love it.
